full_text:
Here's the formations for the Chiefs in their loss to Indy yesterday. 86% of our snaps were in 11 or 12 personnel. Fortson is just not seeing much use. Skyy got 8 real snaps this week. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/WSGjUOs6zk

Here's the defense. 72% of the snaps were in 4-2-5 or 3-3-5. Jones and George the ironmen on the line. Chenal with 10 total snaps (14%). Harris definitely in the Willie Gay role. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/AMojb3E1Ds

Here's the Colts offense and defense. Alec Pierce had a really big impact for playing <50% of the total snaps. Basically just in when its a 3 WR set. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/rauil3fHkG

Through 3 weeks, the Ravens have run 11 personnel on less than 11% of plays.
Next lowest is ATL w/ 19% and then CLE w/ 43%.
#nflverse https://t.co/FsmQRTsN94

Here's the same offense formations chart, with the EPA per Play added. I'll play with this some more during the week, but I like it as an addition. PLEASE note that for any single game, there will be major sample size issues, esp. when its 1 or 2 total snaps.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/713Fk0WRxk https://t.co/n4rh3VJMyQ
